title: Accuser of Gov. Andrew Cuomo Files Criminal Complaint With Albany Sheriff’s Office
sub_head: Complaint involves alleged groping incident included in New York attorney general’s report
body:
ALBANY, N.Y. —One of Gov. Andrew Cuomo’s state aides filed a criminal complaint with the Albany County Sheriff’s Office alleging the Democratic governor groped her during an encounter at the Executive Mansion last year, the sheriff said.
Albany County Sheriff Craig Apple said the woman filed the complaint Thursday afternoon. She has said Mr. Cuomo, a 63-year-old Democrat, reached under her shirt and groped her breast over her bra after she was summoned to the mansion on Nov. 16 for a work assignment.
Brian Premo, an attorney for the woman, said her complaint involved the incident and other allegations of inappropriate touching by Mr. Cuomo that were outlined in a Tuesday report by Attorney General Letitia James. The woman is identified in the report as Executive Assistant #1, Mr. Premo said.
Mr. Cuomo and his lawyer, Rita Glavin, denied the incident happened.
The complaint raises the possibility that Mr. Cuomo could face criminal charges. The woman is the first accuser known to have filed a criminal complaint against the governor. Legal experts say that his alleged behavior could be charged as forcible touching, which is a misdemeanor.
